release.action: Add of property skip in order to skip execution of the plugin.

Add of a new target "generate-titlepage" in order generate titlepage stylesheet that may be needed to configure some customization layers. A sample configuration is available on "docbkx.template" profile.
Allow to pass xsl and some docbkx parameters using the command line or pom properties, they are prefixed with "docbkx.". Example mvn docbkx:generate-pdf -Ddocbkx.draftMode="true"
The xxxCustomization parameter is now properly interpreted relative to basedir.
Add of a possibility to skip execution of this plug-in.
The plugin incorrectly report up-to-date generated PDF when xInclude is used, now when xInclude is used files are regenerated because you do not have much handles on the xml processor for now.
Uppate to latest webhelp-indexer compatible with docbook stylesheets in 1.78.1.
Add of a generate-manpage sample.
"docbkx.external" sample was using an hardcoded path in externalFOPConfiguration.
Update to FOP 1.1 to support hyphenateVerbatim option.
Allow project to specify source file encoding, default UTF-8.
Add of a new target "generate-xhtml5".
Allow the targets to generate xref database files, they will be named <filename>.<extension>.target.db
Add of a new target "generate-epub3".
Update copyright headers and setup maven-license-plugin.
Add of property showXslMessages in order to activate the print of xsl:messages, default is set to false.
The plugin version is not anymore harcoded in the archetype
The property base.dir for html output in non chunking mode was not set thus causing long description to be generated in the root dir.
The new docbook stylesheets make use of property epubEmbeddedFonts instead of epubEmbeddedFont previously
The webhelp output to correctly set the language
Due to the remove of a maven annotation the external fop configuration was not taken into account anymore
Update of samples to use docbook namespace stylesheets (remove of DTD usage)
Fo outputs (pdf and rtf) were not correctly defining the output filename when multiple input files were given
The jalopy:format plugin has suppressed many maven javadoc tags causing many docbkx plugins to not work as expected
The WebHelp indexer is now correctly resetting the indexer

Outputs having the property useStandardOutput set to false will generate their content to a dedicated directory using the input filename as directory name. Current outputs concerned are: (x)html chunked, epub, webhelp, man, eclipse, javahelp
Move to FOP 1.0
Remove deprecated maven configuration keys, mandatory for maven 3 fresh install to compile the plugin
Move to docbook xsl stylesheets 1.76.1
Add support for WebHelp output. WebHelp is a feature-rich, nice looking XSL customization and is a better alternative for web deployments.
Add support for RTF output (Rich Text Format)
EPUB output was not correctly zipping content when multiple input documents were specified
Docbook XML catalogs of both previous and current versions are now correctly loaded.
Add of epub plugin
docbkx-tools plugin now works correctly under maven 3
Bugs in the fop-support plugin was causing the plugin to stop and not working when space characters were encountered into the path.

Add of optional <useStandardOutput/> in docbkx-builder-maven-plugin and the generated Mojos for stylesheets directly writing the target filename (manpages ...) instead of using stdout as transformation result.
Use of latest docbook stylesheets artifacts as dependency instead of embedding parts of docbook stylesheet distribution.
Add of docbkx-quickstart-archetype (@see http://code.google.com/p/docbkx-tools/wiki/UsingArchetypeTemplate)
Fails to create directory with xom xinclude
Add of XHTML support (generate-xhtml goal)
Correction of generation failure when spaces in path.
Moved to FOP 0.95.
Removed use of ExpressionUtils class to avoid property clashes.
Added support of http url in xxxCustomization parameters.
Added generate-javahelp goal.
Added support for setting additional XSL parameters which are not part of the regular docbook parameters using <customizationParameters>.
Added support for setting system properties using <systemProperties> which contains <name> <value> elements pair inside <property> elements.
XSLT Highlighting can now be configured with <xslthlConfig> property or using <systemProperties>.

Enhancement of urn:docbkx:stylesheet which points to the docbook release stylesheet to allow urn:docbkx:stylesheet/xxxx to point to other files of the docbook release. Example: < import href="urn:docbkx:stylesheet/pagesetup.xsl" />.

release.description: Better PDF support and stylesheet update
release.action: Added support for alternative fonts in PDF output.
Replaced FOP 0.20.5 with FOP 0.94.
Moved on to version 1.73.2 of the DocBook XSL stylesheets.
Made sure that documents are not re-built when the sources did not change.
Better support for XInclude allowing includes by id and xml:id.
Added support for syntax highlighting.
Added rudimentary support for generating Eclipse help.
Upgraded the styleseets to version 1.72.0.
Added experimental support for using expression language in processing instructions.
Upgraded the stylesheets to version 1.70.1.

Added support for inserting customization stylesheets. Simply set the foCustomization or htmlCustomization properties, and link the original stylesheets back in by using a symbolic xsl:import. After that, you can use all Bob Sagehills sugestions for customization the output.
Added support for type specific content. The plugin will by default look for a file called docbbkx.{type}.ent. If it exists, then it will be automatically included in the XML document.

release.description: A few enhancements and bug fixes.
release.action: Fixed support for xinclude.
Updated all version numbers to be in sync. (So the link to the specific version of the DocBook templates has been dropped.)
Added support for XInclude. You can now instruct the plugin to process xinclude tags by setting the 'xincludeSupport' property to true.
Unparsed entity references were not handled correctly. As a result, images would not appear in PDF and HTML output.
Added support for chunked HTML output.
Refactored the code to be Java 1.4 compliant.
Added a user guide.
